title: Update Cryptographic Library to Fix JWT Signature Verification Error
summary:
### Summary
This pull request addresses the JWT Signature Verification Error encountered by external applications when authenticating using JSON Web Tokens (JWT). The root cause was identified as an outdated cryptographic library in the CollaborateForce API.

### Changes Made
- Updated the cryptographic library to the latest version to ensure compatibility with JWT signatures generated by external applications.
- Refactored the JWT verification logic to align with the updated library's API.

### Testing
- Verified that JWTs generated by external applications are now correctly verified by the CollaborateForce API.
- Conducted regression testing to ensure no other parts of the application were affected by the library update.
- All unit and integration tests passed successfully.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The updated cryptographic library resolves the JWT signature verification issue effectively, and all tests have passed. Approved for merge.

title: Fix Race Condition in API Key Validation Logic
summary:
This pull request addresses the issue of inconsistent API key validation due to a race condition in the validation logic. The root cause was identified as concurrent requests leading to sporadic access denials. 

To resolve this, the validation logic has been refactored to ensure thread safety and consistent outcomes across concurrent requests. Specifically, synchronization mechanisms have been implemented to manage concurrent access to shared resources during the validation process.

The fix was tested by simulating concurrent API requests in a controlled environment to ensure consistent validation results. Additionally, unit tests have been updated and expanded to cover edge cases related to concurrent access.

review_states.comment: The changes look good to me. The refactoring effectively addresses the race condition, and the testing strategy ensures robustness. Approved for merge.
